nl.inl.blacklab.searches

Interface SearchCache

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FutureSearchResultCache, SearchCacheDebug, SearchCacheDummy

    public interface SearchCache
    A cache that BlackLab will notify of search results, and will query for previously cached results. It is up to the application to implement the cache, deciding what to cache and ensuring the cache doesn't grow too large. The cache implementation should be made thread-safe.

    • Method Detail

      • getAsync

        <R extends SearchResult> Future<R> getAsync(Search<R> search,
                                            Supplier<R> searchTask)
        Get a [future] result for the specified search. If the search is already in the cache, its existing future will be returned. It may or may not have completed already. If the search is not in the cache, it will be started on a new thread and added to the cache, then its future will be returned.
        Parameters:
        search - search we want the result for
        searchTask - if the search is not in the cache, execute this task, returning the future result and putting it in the cache
        fetchAllResults - if true, and search yield a Results object, will fetch all results before the thread ends this can be used for running total counts, for example
        Returns:
        the future, either one that was alrady the cache or a new one using the supplier

      • get

        default <R extends SearchResult> R get(Search<R> search,
                                       Supplier<R> searchTask)
                                throws ExecutionException
        Get result for the specified search. Will block until the result is available. If the search was already in the cache, its existing future will be used. If the search is not in the cache, it will be started and added to the cache, then its result will be returned. The default implementation simply calls getAsync() and waits for the future to complete, but other implementations could choose to perform the task on the current thread as well.
        Parameters:
        search - search we want the result for
        searchTask - if the search is not in the cache, execute this task, returning the future result and putting it in the cache
        Returns:
        the future, either one that was alrady the cache or a new one using the supplier
        Throws:
        InterruptedSearch - if the task was interrupted
        ExecutionException - if the task threw an exception (see the cause)

      • remove

        <R extends SearchResult> Future<R> remove(Search<R> search)
